required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Management of Fetal Growth Restriction at Term: Angiogenic Factors Versus Feto-placental Doppler
clinical_study.official_title: Management of Fetal Growth Restriction at Term: Angiogenic Factors Versus Feto-placental Doppler (GRAFD Trial)

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Open randomized non-inferiority controlled trial to examine the use of angiogenic factors (instead of feto-placental Doppler) for fetal growth restriction at term to reduce the rate of labor inductions, without worsening perinatal outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock:
Pregnant women with estimated fetal weight (EFW) < 10th centile between 36+0 and 37+6 weeks of gestation (WG) will receive complete ultrasonographic assessment consisting of feto-placental Doppler, amniotic fluid measurement and biophysical profile assessment. The cases not meeting any exclusion criteria will be offered to participate in this trial. After giving their informed consent a blood sample will be drawn in all of them and they will undergo randomization into two arms.
1. Intervention arm: In women allocated to the intervention group, the soluble fms-like tyrosine kinase/placental growth factor (sFlt-1/PlGF) result will be revealed to the investigators that will act according to the results of sFlt/PlGF:
- Fetuses with sFlt-1/PlGF ≥38, elective delivery will be recommended at ≥37 weeks.
- Fetuses with sFlt-1/PlGF <38, weekly follow up will be recommended until delivery (at ≥40 weeks).
2. Control arm: In women allocated to the control group, the sFlt-1/PlGF result will be blinded to caregivers. Routine Doppler-based clinical care will be used to counsel women. Following the Doppler classification:
- Fetuses with EFW below the 3rd centile or below the 10th centile accompanied by any impaired fetoplacental Doppler, elective delivery will be recommended at at ≥37 weeks.
- Fetuses with EFW above the 3rd centile without any fetoplacental Doppler abnormality, elective delivery will be recommended at at ≥40 weeks.
In both arms, fetuses will receive weekly follow-up from randomization to delivery consisting on feto-placental Doppler sFlt-1/PlGF and CTG. If any of the following is present at any time, earlier delivery will be recommended:
- sFlt-1/PlGF ≥38 (only in the intervention group),
- absent or reverse end-diastolic flow at the umbilical artery Doppler or DV PI>95th centile
- non-reassuring CTG
- preeclampsia
- diminished fetal movements
- biophysical profile ≤ 6 or oligohydramnios (deepest pocket <2 cm).

primary_outcome.description: Cesarean delivery for non-reassuring fetal status or neonatal acidosis (artery cord potential of hydrogen (pH) <7.15 + base excess > -12 milliequivalent/L)
Percentage of women that required an elective delivery <39 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women that required a Cesarean delivery
Percentage of women that required an induction of labor

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of neonatal admission in intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of newborns that required admission in intensive care

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of neonatal admission in intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.description: Days in in intensive care of newborns that required admission
Percentage of women that developed preeclampsia
Percentage of newborns with adverse outcomes
Percentage of women with adverse outcomes

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of deliveries at <37, <38, <39 and <40 weeks of gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women that delivered at <37, <38, <39 and <40 weeks of gestation

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of newborns with birthweight <2000 and <2500 grams
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women that delivered a newborn with a birthweight <2000 and <2500 grams

arm_group.description: Clinical practice: Management by Doppler and CTG findings. In women allocated to the control group, the sFlt-1/PlGF result will be blinded to caregivers. Routine Doppler-based clinical care will be used to counsel women. Following the Doppler classification: Fetuses with an EFW below the 3rd centile or below the 10th centile accompanied by any impaired fetoplacental Doppler, elective delivery will be recommended at at ≥37 weeks. Fetuses with an EFW above the 3rd centile without any fetoplacental Doppler abnormality, elective delivery will be recommended at at ≥40 weeks.

intervention.description: In women allocated to the intervention group, the sFlt-1/PlGF result will be revealed to the investigators that will act according to the results of sFlt/PlGF: Fetuses with sFlt-1/PlGF ≥38, elective delivery will be recommended at ≥37 weeks. Fetuses with sFlt-1/PlGF <38 weekly follow up will be recommended and delivery at ≥40 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant women ≥ 16 years of age.
2. Singleton pregnancy.
3. Ultrasonographic estimated fetal weight <10th centile.
4. Gestational age between 36+0 and 37+6 weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Major fetal malformations or genetic disorders.
2. Fetal death.
3. Absent or reverse end-diastolic flow in umbilical artery Doppler or DV PI>95th centile.
4. Non-reassuring cardiotocography (CTG).
5. Preeclampsia.
6. Diminished fetal movements.
7. Biophysical profile ≤ 6.
8. Oligohydramnios
9. Refusal to give informed consent.
